objective.title: Real Estate Negotiation: A 2-Student Mini-Project
objective.description: Navigate a realistic real estate transaction from initial offer to closing, practicing negotiation skills, financial analysis, and contract understanding
objective.context: A real estate transaction between a first-time homebuyer and a motivated seller. Both parties need to understand market conditions, financing options, inspection processes, and negotiation strategies to reach a successful closing.

phases.title: Market Analysis Phase
phases.description: Research current market conditions and comparable property values

phases.title: Offer Preparation
phases.description: Prepare and present initial purchase offer with terms and conditions

phases.title: Price Negotiation
phases.description: Negotiate price, terms, and contingencies between buyer and seller

phases.title: Inspection & Appraisal
phases.description: Coordinate property inspection and mortgage appraisal processes

phases.title: Final Contract Review
phases.description: Review and finalize purchase agreement with all negotiated terms

phases.title: Transaction Closing
phases.description: Complete the real estate transaction and transfer ownership

1.objective: As the Homebuyer, you are a first-time buyer looking to purchase your ideal home within budget while ensuring you get the best value and terms in this competitive market

Market Research: Research comparable sales in the neighborhood
Calculate maximum affordable offer price based on your budget
Review property features and condition against your priorities
Initial Offer: Determine your opening offer strategy and price point
Select financing terms and down payment amount
Draft initial offer letter with contingencies
Negotiation: Work toward mutually acceptable terms and price
Due Diligence: Review inspection findings and determine next steps
Contract Finalization: Confirm mortgage approval and funding timeline
Closing: Sign all closing documents and loan papers
Receive keys and official ownership transfer

2.objective: As the Home Seller, you need to sell your property quickly due to job relocation while maximizing your sale price and minimizing complications during the transaction

Market Research: Review recent comparable sales to validate listing price
Analyze current market conditions and buyer demand
Initial Offer: Review buyer's offer against your expectations
Calculate net proceeds from different price scenarios
Negotiation: Negotiate inspection terms and repair responsibilities
Balance price with timeline to meet relocation needs
Due Diligence: Coordinate access for buyer's home inspection
Review inspection report and negotiate repair requests
Facilitate appraiser access and provide property details
Contract Finalization: Review and approve final contract amendments
Confirm closing timeline works with your relocation
Prepare for document signing and title transfer
Closing: Complete any agreed-upon repairs or credits
Attend closing to sign transfer documents
Hand over keys and complete ownership transfer
